newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares seen down after Monday's slight gain.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares seen down after Monday's slight gain.

text.p: Polish shares were expected to fall on Tuesday after Monday's slight gain and analysts said the market should continue its slight downtrend during this week's public offering of copper giant KGHM Polska Miedz SA.
On Tuesday the 15 National Investment Funds (NIF) in Poland's mass privatisation programme join the 23 firms already in continuous trade.
Analysts said the funds' strong buying after price-fixing on Monday signalled that their main NIF index would probably extend gains on Tuesday after last week's slump.
They said Bank Handlowy, which started trade on the main market on Monday 8.3 percent above issue at 37.9 zlotys, could rise toward 40 zlotys before falling.
